page.title: 11ST. MARY'S CHURCH
page.content: The present building was rebuilt in 1878,& contains some features of the former church from the same site. The porch was completed in 1906 and the tower in 1911.The building is large & imposing & thought by many visitors to be much older.In 1982 the chancel floor was removed owing to creeping decay & was out of use for nearly a year. During this time major repairs were also found necessary to the Chancel roof, so the Church Council embarked on an energetic campaign of fund raising. As a result of many generous gifts, the repairs were completed & the Chancel reinstated.A planned programme of improvements is being carried out-phase 1,painting the entire Chancel;2,painting the North & South Aisles;3,providing new lighting; 4,painting the Nave. Additionally, general repairs & maintenance continue
